Nom_complet_Anglais: Behavioural Inhibition System (BIS) and the Behavioural Approach System (BAS)
Nom Fealinx: BIS-BAS - Behavioural Inhibition System and the Behavioural Approach System
Description: Échelle d'impulsivité et de capacité d'autorégulation
Ref_originales: Carver & White (1994), Journal of Personality and Social Psychology
Ref_Traduction_FR: Caci et al. (2007), Personality and individual differences
Column25: The BIS/BAS Scale is a 24-item self-report questionnaire designed to measure two motivational systems: the behavioral inhibition system (BIS), which corresponds to motivation to avoid aversive outcomes, and the behavioral activation system (BAS), which corresponds to motivation to approach goal-oriented outcomes. Participants respond to each item using a 4-point Likert scale: 1 (very true for me), 2 (somewhat true for me), 3 (somewhat false for me), and 4 (very false for me). The scale has four subscales that were derived via factor analysis. One subscale corresponds to the BIS. Seven items contribute to this score (e.g., “Criticism or scolding hurts me quite a bit”). The remaining three subscales correspond to three components of BAS. BAS Drive measures the motivation to follow one’s goals. Four items contribute to this score (e.g., “When I want something I usually go all-out to get it”). BAS Reward Responsiveness measures the sensitivity to pleasant reinforcers in the environment. Four items contribute to this score (e.g., “It would excite me to win a contest”). BAS Fun Seeking measures the motivation to find novel rewards spontaneously. Five items contribute to this score (e.g., “I crave excitement and new sensations”).

Nom Fealinx: BPRS24 - Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale 24 Items

Nom_complet_Anglais: Brief COPE (Coping Orientations to the Problems Experienced)
Nom Fealinx: Brief COPE - Coping Orientations to the Problems Experienced
Ref_originales: Carver et al. (1997), International journal of behavioral medicine
Ref_Traduction_FR: Muller & Spitz (2003), L'encéphale
Column25: The Brief COPE is a 28-item multidimensional measure of strategies used for coping or regulating cognitions in response to stressors. This abbreviated inventory (based on the complete 60-item COPE Inventory) is comprised of items that assess the frequency with which a person uses different coping strategies (e.g., “I've been turning to work or other activities to take my mind off things,” “I've been making fun of the situation,” “I’ve been criticizing myself”) rated on a scale from 1, I haven't been doing this at all, to 4, I've been doing this a lot. There are 14 two-item subscales within the Brief COPE, and each is analyzed separately: (1) self-distraction, (2) active coping, (3) denial, (4) substance use, (5) use of emotional support, (6) use of instrumental support, (7) behavioral disengagement, (8) venting, (9) positive reframing, (10) planning, (11) humor, (12) acceptance, (13) religion, and (14) self-blame.

Nom Fealinx: IAT - Implicit Association Test
Description: The Implicit Association Test (IAT) measures attitudes and beliefs that people may be unwilling or unable to report. The IAT may be especially interesting if it shows that you have an implicit attitude that you did not know about.  / visent donc à "explorer" les fondements de pensées implicites (non contrôlable consciemment) des participants.
Ref_originales: Greenwald, A. G., McGhee, D. E., & Schwartz, J. L. (1998). Measuring individual differences in implicit cognition: the implicit association test. Journal of personality and social psychology, 74(6), 1464.

Description: SF-12 -- OrthoToolKit. About the score. The 12-item Short Form Survey (SF-12) is a general health questionnaire that was first published in 1995 as part of the Medical Outcomes Study (MOS). The SF-12 was constructed using questions drawn from each of the 8 dimensions of the MOS 36 item Short Form Survey (SF-36).

Nom Fealinx: TSCS Parents Present - Tennessee Self Concept Scale - Parents Present
Description: Evalue la représentation de soi (estime de soi/mémoire autobiographique)
Ref_originales: Fitts & Warren (1996), Los Angeles: Western Psychological Services
Ref_Traduction_FR: Duval et al. (2007), Psychologie & NeuroPsychiatrie du vieillissement

Nom_complet_Anglais: Verbal Paired Associates (VPA) test from the Wechsler Memory Scale III (WMS-III)
Description: Evalue la mémoire/capacité d'apprentissage
Ref_originales: Wechsler (1997) San Antonio, TX: Psychological Corporation.
Ref_Traduction_FR: Wechsler, Gregoire et Penhouet (2001), Ed. ECPA

Nom_complet_Français: VOSP Batterie de Perception Visuelle et Spatiale des objets
Nom_complet_Anglais: Visual Object and Space Perception Battery (VOSP)
Ref_originales: Warrington & James (1991), Pearson
Ref_Traduction_FR: Warrington & James (2000), EAP

Nom Fealinx: WAIS III - Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale

Nom_complet_Français: Test des proverbes de la WAIS-III
Nom Fealinx: WAIS III PROVERB - Test Of Proverbs From WAIS III
Description: Mesure le raisonnement/capacité d'abstraction mentale

Nom_complet_Français: Test des similitudes de la WAIS-III
Nom Fealinx: WAIS III SIMIL - Test Of Similarities From WAIS III
Description: Subtest issu de la WAIS évaluant le raisonnement/capacité de synthèse

NOM_REDCAP: WAIS IV - Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale
Ref_originales: Wechsler (2008)
Ref_Traduction_FR: Wechsler (2011), Montreuil: ECPA Pearson

Nom_complet_Français: Echelle abrégée d'intelligence de Wechsler III - WASI
Ref_originales: D Wechsler (1999, 2011)
Ref_Traduction_FR: Adaptat. Fçse D Wechsler WASI (1999) WASI-II (2011)

Description: Evalue la flexibilité mentale/planification/raisonnement
Ref_originales: Grant & Berg (1948), American Psychologist 3
Ref_Traduction_FR: Milner (1963), Forme abrégée Nelson (1976), Chelune, Baer (1986) Heaton et al. (2002)

Nom_complet_Français: Echelle Clinique de Mémoire - MEM-III  de Wechsler-Bellevue

Nom_complet_Anglais: Minor Physical Anomalies (from Waldrop Physical Anomaly Scale)
NOM_REDCAP: Waldrop Minor Physical Anomalies
Nom Fealinx: WLDR - Minor Physical Anomalies (from Waldrop Physical Anomaly Scale)
Description: Dépistage de dysmorphies (faciales, mains, lèvres…) dites mineures
Ref_originales: Waldrop et al. (1968), Child development.
Ref_Traduction_FR: Gourion, Krebs et al. (2003) Schizophrenia Research.

Ref_originales: Ward et al. (1993), Am J Psychiatry

Nom Fealinx: YBOCS - Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale
Description: Outil de dépistage de TOC critères DSM
Ref_originales: Goodman et al. (1989), Archives of general psychiatry
Ref_Traduction_FR: Mollard et al. (1989), Revue de psychiatrie clinique biologique et thérapeutique

Nom Fealinx: YMRS - Young Mania Rating Scale
Description: Outil de dépistage de symptômes hypomanes et maniaques et de leur sévérité critères DSM
Ref_originales: Young  et al. (1978), The Bristish Journal of Psychiatry
Ref_Traduction_FR: Favre et al. (2003), L'Encéphale

Nom_complet_Anglais: WHO Quality of Life Scale - Abbreviated Version
Ref_originales: World Health Organization (2004)

Nom_complet_Français: Test du plan du zoo (batterie BADS)

Ref_originales: Wilson et al. (1996)
Ref_Traduction_FR: Traduction Fçse mais non validée P Allain (2004)  Version enfant BADS-C

Nom Fealinx: Dépistage Psy - TOCs (OCI) + AQ10 + ASRSs + SCOFF
